Comment.Language: The twelve Gospels are read at the twelve stations in the church:

Text.Language: Pif~tou n~zwon n~a~cwmatoc: etfai qa piharma n~te V]: ouho m~moui nem ouho m~maci: ouho n~rwmi nem ouho n~a~/~toc.
The four incorporeal creatures / who carry the chariot of the Lord / a face of a lion, a face of an ox / a face of a man and a face of an eagle.
الأربعة حيوانات غير المتجسدين الحاملين مركبة الله وجه أسد ووجه ثور ووجه انسان ووجه نسر.

Title.Language: Second Gospel (Before the Icon of St. Mary)
Third Gospel (Before the Icon of Archangel Gabriel)

Text.Language: Gabri/l piaggeloc: afnau e~rof n~je Dani/l: efo~hi e~ratf hijen nefvat: hijen nenc~votou m~v~iaro.
Gabriel the angel, / Daniel saw / standing on his feet, / by the riverbank.
غبريال الملاك رآه دانيال واقفاً علي قدميه علي شاطئ النهر.

Title.Language: Fourth Gospel (Before the Icon of Archangel Michael)

Text.Language: Mi,a/l p~ar,wn n~naniv/oui: n~yof etoi n~sorp: qen nitaxic n~aggelikon: efsemsi m~pem~yo m~P[oic.
Michael, the head of the heavenly, / he is the first / among the angelic ranks / serving before the Lord.
ميخائيل رئيس السمائيين هو الأول في الطقوس الملائكية يخدم أمام الرب.

Title.Language: Fifth Gospel (Before the Icon of St. Mark)

Text.Language: Markoc pia~poctoloc: ouoh pieuaggelict/c: pimeyre qa nim~kauh: n~te pimonogen/c n~nou].
O Mark the Apostle / and the Evangelist, / the witness to the Passion / of the only-begotten God.
مارمرقس الرسول والإنجيلي الشاهد علي آلام الإله الوحيد.

Title.Language: Sixth Gospel (Before the Icon of the Apostles)

Text.Language: I/couc Pi,~rictoc afouwrp m~mwten: w~ pim/t c~nau n~a~poctoloc: e~tetenhiwis qen nieynoc: e~reten aitou n~,~rictianoc.
Jesus Christ sent you, O twelve apostles, to preach in the nations, making them Christians.
أرسلكم يسوع المسيح أيها الإثنا عشر رسولاً لتبشروا في الأمم وتصيروهم مسيحيين.

Title.Language: Seventh Gospel (Before the Icon of Any Martyr)

Text.Language: Sasf n~rompi afjokou e~bol: n~je v/eyouab Gewrgioc: e~re pio# n~ouro n~a~nomoc: eu]hap e~rof m~m/ini.
Saint George completed / seven whole years, / being judged daily / by seventy lawless kings.
سبع سنين أكملها القديس جورجيوس وسبعون ملكاً منافقين يحكمون عليه كل يوم.
<ere nak w~ pimarturoc: ,ere piswij n~genneoc: ,ere piaylovoroc: (…)
Hail to you O martyr: hail to the courageous hero: hail to the struggle bearer: (…)
السلام لك أيها الشهيد: السلام للبطل الشجاع السلام للابس الجهاد (...)

Title.Language: Eighth Gospel (Before the Icon of Any Saint)

Text.Language: Bwl e~bol qen netenh/t: n~nimokmek n~te ]kakia: nem nimeui~ etsebswb: eti~ri m~pinouc n~,aki.
Purge from your hearts / thoughts of vice / and deceiving ideas / that darken the mind.
حلوا من قلوبكم أفكار الشر والظنون الخداعة التي تظلم العقل.
Aksani~ qen tekmahc~nou]: m~paroucia etoi n~ho]: m~peny~rencwtem qen ouc~yerter: je ]cwoun m~mwten an.
When You come in Your second, fearful appearance, do not let us fearfully hear, “I do not know you.”
متي أتيت في ظهورك الثاني المخوف فلا نسمع برعدة أنني لست أعرفكم.
Afermeyre n~je Iwann/c: qen pif~tou n~euaggelion: je ai]wmc m~Pacwt/r: qen: nimwou n~te Piiordan/c.
John has borne witness / in the four Gospels, / saying “I have baptized my Savior / in the waters of the Jordan.”
شهد يوحنا في الأربعة أناجيل أني عمدت مخلصي في مياه الأردن.
V/ethemci hijen ni,eroubim: hijen piy~ronoc n~te pefw~ou: afse e~qoun e~Il#/#m#: oupe pains] n~yebio.
He who sits upon the cherubim, / on the throne of His glory, / entered into Jerusalem; / what is this great humility?
الجالس علي الشيروبيم علي كرسي مجده دخل أورشليم يا له من تواضع عظيم.

Title.Language: Twelfth Gospel (Before the Icon of St. John the Baptist)

Text.Language: Mpe ouon twnf qen nijinmici: n~te nihiomi efo~ni m~mok: n~yok ounis] qen n/eyouab t/rou: Iwann/c piref]wmc.
Among those born of women / no one is like you. / You are great among all the saints, / O John the Baptist.
لم يقم في مواليد النساء من يشبهك أنت عظيم في جميع القديسين يا يوحنا المعمدان

Comment.Language: After the reading of the twelfth Gospel, the procession is continued two times around the nave of the church, while the deacons chant "Blessed is He (Eulogimenoc)":
After the reading of the twelfth Gospel, the procession is continued two times around the nave of the church, while the deacons chant the "Hymn of Constantine (Etauen Nic~qai)":
